channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-7781] Update security unit tests to use a KDC if available
item.description:
We currently have large holes in the test coverage of HBase with security enabled. Two recent examples of bugs which really should have been caught with testing are HBASE-7771 and HBASE-7772. The long standing problem with testing with security enabled has been the requirement for supporting kerberos infrastructure.

We need to close this gap and provide some automated testing with security enabled, if necessary standing up and provisioning a temporary KDC as an option for running integration tests, see HADOOP-8078 and HADOOP-9004 where a similar approach was taken.
item.summary: Update security unit tests to use a KDC if available

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: HBASE-7829 is another.

+1. Actually, we need both the unit test and integration test coverage. Current IT framework does not deal with deploying the cluster. Though given a deployed secure cluster, and sufficient privileges (to SSH, kill servers, etc), it should run out of the box.
I was able to run this successfully in 0.94 against a kerberos-enabled secure cluster. Any tried this in 0.96?
HADOOP-9848 was committed to trunk. HADOOP-9866 provides an example of how to use it for unit tests. Perhaps we should request a backport to Hadoop 2.1.0-beta. See HBASE-8165 also.
Blocker for the 0.98 RC process.
Can i take this up Andrew? This would help in 0.98 RC testing also?
Sure, Ram, go for it. Thanks a lot!

I suggest renaming the title.
We have been running the integration tests on secure clusters for some time without any issues (both 94 and 96 code bases). Current IT test framework will not deploy the cluster, but if a secure cluster is given, it will run on top.

Unit tests however is a different story. We need the miniKDC there for running the UT's in secure mode, or specifically writing security unit tests.

I suggest renaming the title.

Good idea, how about "Update security unit tests to use a KDC if available".
Sounds good. Thanks Andrew.

Before proceeding with the JIRA, so I went through what is given in all the JIRAs mentioned here. HADOOP-8078 also tries to start the ApacheDS but it seems to be an older version.
HADOOP-9848 introduces miniKDC in the hadoop project itself as a module.
So we would also be introducing the miniKDC in HBase side and all security testcases will run that along with the cluster?
So the miniKDC available in hbase will be a seperate module(like in hadoop) or will it be a class that just allows to start a minikdc?

Have a look at the utility classes (and tests) under hbase-server src/test in org.apache.hadoop.hbase.security. We want helpers that allow a test writer to start a mini KDC. I don't think we can depend on Hadoop's mini KDC module yet until it is in a release. Then it would be nice to have an integration test that starts up the mini KDC and uses it if running in a minicluster configuration.

Have a look at the utility classes (and tests) under hbase-server src/test in org.apache.hadoop.hbase.security

Yes Andy. Exactly doing that.
I understand that using miniKDC we could define our own principles, and add proper kdc configuraitons for the NN, DN, RS and master. Using that the security test should be running.
I hope in testcases too once the security is enabled through kerberos, secure DN and secure NN starts running. Let me see that.

If my realm is hbase@HADOOP.LOCALDOMAIN, what should be the contents of the keytab file? I get this error

Ideally the code should use the keyTab. Am trying to use the MiniKDC here. TestUsersOperationsWithSecureHadoop - this test gets skipped in the actual builds i think as it needs the keytab and principle to be passed.

Pressed the button pretty early.
When i try running the testMiniKDC as given in the hadoop JIRA,


Subject subject = new Subject(false, principals, new HashSet<Object>(),

              new HashSet<Object>());

      loginContext = new LoginContext("", subject, null,

              KerberosConfiguration.createClientConfig(principal, keytab));

      loginContext.login();

      subject = loginContext.getSubject();

     loginContext.login();

This works fine using similar principal. But when going thro the UGI code it does not work.
Any update?
sorry Andy. I was stuck in the above mentioned comment. Will try again tomorrow.
No patch, moving out.
Any progress of this issue?

Liu Shaohui
I tried doing this but adding the new stuff for the pom.xml and creating a MiniKDC class. But I have not progressed after that. Feel free to take it up.

Thanks, ramkrishna.s.vasudevan.
Since the hadoop-minikdc has been in the hadoop 0.23, I will have a try if we can build security unit test env with the minikdc.

Liu Shaohui Is there any progress of this issue?
When addressing HBASE-12953 I use hadoop-minikdc to run TestSecureRPC, and then I found there was already a issue about run security unit tests with MiniKdc.
Thanks~
I think you can take this if you want it Duo Zhang

I think there are 3 things to do.
First is to modify the unit tests that already need a kerberos environment to use minikdc.
Second is to modify other security unit tests to use minikdc if we can gain better coverage.
Third is hbase-it, we can see if we can start a secure minicluster when running integration tests on minicluster.

The first thing is simple and I can do it right now.
The second and third thing need more preparing work. I will post my findings later when I decide to start working on them.

Thanks Andrew Purtell
Items #2 and #3 could be done in separate issues, subissues of this?
#1 and #2 could be sub tasks, and I think #3 should be another issue since the title contains "unit tests".

A jacoco coverage report for hbase-server module.

For security related packages

org.apache.hadoop.hbase.security.visibility.expression 53%
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.security.access 45%
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.security.token 44%

I think 'token' is authentication so maybe related to Kerberos. 'access' and 'visibility' should be authorization.

Plan to take a look at the token package.

And is it worth to work on showing jacoco coverage report on jenkins? Now we only show test result there. stack

I think the only thing related to kerberos is TokenProvider. It only allows to generateToken when user is already authed with kerberos. Will open a sub task to deal with it.

I think we can resolve this issue after this. Can create another issue if we want to setup secure minicluster when running integration tests.

So resolve this issue now? Any objections?
Thanks.

And is it worth to work on showing jacoco coverage report on jenkins?

Would be a nice-to-have, yes. It is one of those things that we don't know we are missing until it starts showing up regular under our noses. Low priority though I'd say (your test fixing is way more critical and appreciated Duo Zhang)

Any objections?

None from me. Go for it I'd say. Issue can be reopened if you are in error or a new more narrow issue filed to address any work remaining.

Would be a nice-to-have, yes. It is one of those things that we don't know we are missing until it starts showing up regular under our noses. Low priority though I'd say

OK. Let me create a minor issue for it

Update some authentication related unit tests to use miniKDC so resolve this now.
Open new issue if we want to use secure mini cluster in integration tests.
Closing issues released in 1.1.0.
